edu.northwestern.jcr.adapter.xtf.query
Class SearchIndex

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.AbstractQueryHandler
      edu.northwestern.jcr.adapter.xtf.query.SearchIndex
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.QueryHandler
public class SearchIndex
extends org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.AbstractQueryHandler

Implements a Jackrabbit query handler using Fedora.

Both the XPath and SQL queries are translated by the Jackrabbit core to the Abstract Query Tree (AQT), the common query description format that allows Jackrabbit to implement a query engine which is (to a certain extent) independent of the query syntax used (XPath or SQL). The "Search Implementation" section of the Jackrabbit website details the implementation of searches in Jackrabbit along with the default search index being used.

The search index in Jackrabbit is pluggable and has a default implementation based on Apache Lucene. The default implementation is independent of the persistence manager being used. To connect to an existing XTF repository, this search index manager is written to interpret the AQT and generate raw XML queries that can be executed against the raw servlet of the XTF repository.

In the default workspace configuration file jackrabbit/workspaces/default/workspace.xml this XTF search index is set as the search index used by the Jackrabbit repository (in place of the default Lucene search index).

The default Jackrabbit search index actually maintains the index using Apache Lucene as well as running the parsed queries against the Lucene index. This search index, on the other hand, only handles queries since the "index" for XTF documents is maintained by XTF repository.

ORDER BY clause is handled here by the sort(java.lang.String[], java.util.Map, boolean[]) method. Other than that this class is little more than a wrapper of query handling classes.

Author:
Xin Xiang

useCompoundFile

Compound file flag

documentOrder

private boolean documentOrder
Flag indicating whether document order is enabled as the default ordering.

Default value is: false.

forceConsistencyCheck

private boolean forceConsistencyCheck
If set true the index is checked for consistency on startup. If false a consistency check is only performed when there are entries in the redo log on startup.

Default value is: false.

consistencyCheckEnabled

private boolean consistencyCheckEnabled
If set true the index is checked for consistency depending on the forceConsistencyCheck parameter. If set to false, no consistency check is performed, even if the redo log had been applied on startup.

Default value is: false.

autoRepair

private boolean autoRepair
If set true errors detected by the consistency check are repaired. If false the errors are only reported in the log.

Default value is: true.

cacheSize

private int cacheSize
The uuid resolver cache size.

Default value is: 1000.

resultFetchSize

private int resultFetchSize
The number of documents that are pre fetched when a query is executed.

Default value is: Integer.MAX_VALUE.

supportHighlighting

private boolean supportHighlighting
If set to true the fulltext field is stored and and a term vector is created with offset information.

Default value is: false.

closed

private boolean closed
Indicates if this SearchIndex is closed and cannot be used anymore.

createExecutableQuery

public org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.ExecutableQuery createExecutableQuery(org.apache.jackrabbit.core.SessionImpl session,
                                                                              org.apache.jackrabbit.core.ItemManager itemMgr,
                                                                              java.lang.String statement,
                                                                              java.lang.String language)
                                                                       throws javax.jcr.query.InvalidQueryException
Creates a new query by specifying the query statement itself and the language in which the query is stated. If the query statement is syntactically invalid, given the language specified, an InvalidQueryException is thrown. language must specify a query language string from among those returned by QueryManager.getSupportedQueryLanguages(); if it is not then an InvalidQueryException is thrown.

Parameters:
session - the session of the current user creating the query object.
itemMgr - the item manager of the current user.
statement - the query statement.
language - the syntax of the query statement.
Returns:
A Query object.
Throws:
javax.jcr.query.InvalidQueryException - if statement is invalid or language is unsupported.

createExecutableQuery

public org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.ExecutableQuery createExecutableQuery(org.apache.jackrabbit.core.SessionImpl session,
                                                                              org.apache.jackrabbit.core.ItemManager itemMgr,
                                                                              org.apache.jackrabbit.spi.commons.query.qom.QueryObjectModelTree qomTree)
                                                                       throws javax.jcr.query.InvalidQueryException
Creates a new query by specifying the query object model. If the query object model is considered invalid for the implementing class, an InvalidQueryException is thrown.

Parameters:
session - the session of the current user creating the query object.
itemMgr - the item manager of the current user.
qomTree - query query object model tree.
Returns:
A Query object.
Throws:
javax.jcr.query.InvalidQueryException - if the query object model tree is invalid.
See Also:
QueryHandler.createExecutableQuery(SessionImpl, ItemManager, QueryObjectModelTree)

sort

private java.lang.String[] sort(java.lang.String[] lines,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> valueMap,
                                boolean[] orderSpecs)
Sorts the query results based on the value of the properties. The ORDER BY clause is actually handled here.

Parameters:
lines - array of comma-separated full paths to the query results
valueMap - maps pid to comma-separated values
orderSpecs - true for ascending, false for descending
Returns:
array of sorted results

executeQuery

public MultiColumnQueryHits executeQuery(org.apache.jackrabbit.core.SessionImpl session,
                                         AbstractQueryImpl queryImpl,
                                         XTFQuery query,
                                         org.apache.jackrabbit.spi.Name[] orderProps,
                                         boolean[] orderSpecs)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.lang.Exception
Sorts the query results and converts them to query hits (in the form "{} {}path1 {}path2 ..."). Note at this point the XTFQuery object is already populated with query results.

Parameters:
session - the session that executes the query.
queryImpl - the query impl.
query - the Fedora query with the result list already populated.
orderProps - name of the properties for sort order.
orderSpecs - the order specs for the sort order properties. true indicates ascending order, false indicates descending.
Returns:
the query hits.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while searching the index.
java.lang.Exception

public NamespaceMappings getNamespaceMappings()
Returns the namespace mappings for the internal representation.

the namespace mappings for the internal representation.

private void checkOpen()
                throws java.io.IOException
Checks if this SearchIndex is open, otherwise throws an IOException.

java.io.IOException - if this SearchIndex had been closed.
